thread.title: Glenwood doubles team stays alive in girls state tennis
thread.title_full: Glenwood doubles team stays alive in girls state tennis

author: Staff report
title: Glenwood doubles team stays alive in girls state tennis
text: Glenwood doubles team stays alive in girls state tennis Comment Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 9:42 PM Updated at 9:42 PM By Staff report Posted Oct. 22, 2015 at 9:42 PM BUFFALO GROVE — The Chatham Glenwood High School doubles team of Natalie Odin and Anna Lytchakov won three of four matches Thursday and was the only Central State Eight Conference entry to stay alive at the Girls State Tennis Tournament in the Chicago suburbs. Odin and Lytchakov, the Springfield Sectional champs, will face 17-32 seeds Audrey Angelos and Maya Trinka of Oak Park River Forest today in the consolation fourth round at Rolling Meadows. The Titans duo won its first-round match, 6-1, 6-0 over West Chicago Wheaton Academy’s Maisie Howland and Lily Bracy. Odin and Lytchakov then lost to 17-32 seeds Shelby Johnson and Madelynn Jurasek of Aurora Christian 6-4, 7-5 in the second round of the championship’s bracket. Odin and Lytchakov kept their tournament going by winning two straight matches in the consolation draw. They defeated Rachel Habbal and Brooke Zielke of Palos Heights Shepard 6-1, 6-0, and beat Elk Grove Village’s Jovana Vujanic and Lauren Oda 6-1, 6-2. Other CS8 entrants Lincoln senior Kena Bere won two consolation matches before ending her tournament run with a 6-4, 6-1 loss to Sophia Osabuohien Homewood Flossmoor in the consolation’s third round. Bere lost her championship bracket match to Rock Island’s Nicole Tyulpa 6-0, 6-1. She then defeated Jessica Minkov of Franklin Park Northlake 6-3, 6-3, and downed Reagan Ridgway of Herrin 6-2, 6-1. Glenwood junior Haneen Said, playing in her first state tournament, won a championship bracket match by posting a 6-4, 7-5 victory over Kaitlyn O’Brien of Rock Island. Said lost her next two matches, falling to Haleigh Porter (6-0, 6-0) of Homewood Flossmoor and Kendall Oldham (6-1, 6-0) of Glenview Glenbrook South, respectively. Jacksonville senior Lucy Deal won a consolation match by defeating Morton’s Crystal Cobler 6-4, 5-7 (10-7). Deal slipped into the consolation draw after losing to Sycamore’s Kathryn Sullivan 6-3, 6-2 in the championship draw. She ended the tournament with a 6-1, 6-0 loss to Carlie Wilson of LaGrange Park Nazareth Academy. Sacred Heart-Griffin failed to win a match at the tournament. Sophomore Hannah Abrahamson, the Springfield Sectional singles champ, lost a pair of matches in her first state meet. She dropped a 6-3, 6-0 decision to Carbondale’s Arina Martin, and lost to Joie Reisch of LaGrange 6-3, 6-2. The SHG doubles team of Isabel Cross and Claire Nachtwey also lost two matches. Brynn Carlson and Julianna Roman of Lake Forest — seeded 17-32 — defeated Cross and Nachtwey 6-4, 6-3 in the championship bracket. Cross and Nachtwey ended the meet with a 6-4, 4-6, (10-6) loss to Lemont’s Ashley Mathews and Gabby Rabianski in the consolation’s first round. By Staff report
